newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Christopher sees urgent need for concrete results.
newsitem.headline: Christopher sees urgent need for concrete results.

text.p: U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher said on Sunday that an explosion of violence in the Middle East had shown the urgent need for Israelis and Palestinians to reach concrete results.

"The recent violence has demonstrated the great urgency of reaching some concrete results just as soon as possible," he told a joint news conference in Jerusalem with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

"The prime minister assured me that he understands the context of these negotiations is to go forward with the implementation of the interim agreement which he understands there is an obligation to carry out," Christopher said.
Netanyahu sought to calm Palestinian fears that he wanted to rewrite the Oslo interim self-rule agreement signed by his Labour party predecessors.
"We did not propose opening the agreement. We suggested that within the confines of the existing agreement adjustments be made," he told the news conference.
Netanyahu wants to modify security arrangements for Jewish settlers in the West Bank city of Hebron.
